settings.name: Beginning of period to cluster
settings.description: Provide a datetime from which to begin clustering.

settings.name: End of period to cluster
settings.description: Provide a datetime on which to end clustering.

settings.name: Increment between clusterings (days)
settings.description: Provide a time increment (number of days) to increase by between each clustering. Default is a 1-day rolling window, though this is computationally demanding for large datasets.

settings.name: Window of data to be used in clustering
settings.description: Provide a time window (number of days). Before clustering any given period, the data will be filtered to a time window of this duration before the clusterdate.

settings.name: Maximum inactive cluster event duration
settings.description: Provide a time window (number of days) for the maximum duration of an 'inactive' cluster. That is, if no data is added to this cluster for this duration of time, the cluster will be 'closed' (no further data can be incorporated to this cluster).

settings.name: Use behavioural classification clustering?
settings.description: Select TRUE if this dataset contains a 'behav' column appended by `Behavioural Classification for Avian Species`. If false, the clustering will be performed on all available data.

settings.name: Cluster ID Code
settings.description: This string will be appended to the names of clusters to differentiate between the clusters generated by different studies. For example, setting this equal to 'ABC' will give output clusters designated 'ABC.1', 'ABC.2', and so on. Default is 'A'.

settings.name: Agglomerative Parameter Cut-Height
settings.description: The height at which to cut the dendrogram generated by the hierarchical clustering process. Default is 500.
